intro: Galium hercynicum subsp. vivianum, commonly known as the Hercegovinian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats.
